name: The Cheese Train
abstract: Rustic and authentic! Enjoy an unforgettable day in Pays-d'Enhaut.
description:
The day begins with a ride on a GoldenPass-MOB scenic train from Montreux or Zweisimmen. In Château-d’Oex, you will discover the secrets of making a Swiss alpine cheese.
At the restaurant Le Chalet, the farmer makes one “Le Chalet Bio” cheese per day from 400 litres of fresh milk in the traditional way – over a wood fire. Enjoy your delicious fondue in this rustic setting. Above the restaurant on the first floor, you will find the GoldenPass MOB trains miniature railway, which will make the eyes of big and small visitors shine brightly. Lastly, a “souvenir bag” will be given to you in the restaurant to remember this truly Swiss experience. In the afternoon visit the Musée du Pays-d'Enhaut where you can discover the treasures of local crafts and the art of paper-cutting.

The return time to your starting point or the onward journey on the GoldenPass MOB trains is at your free choice. Reserving a seat for this is recommended but not included in the price.

FACTS
Route: Montreux/Zweisimmen – Château d’Oex – Montreux/Zweisimmen
Duration: approx. 4 h 

TIMETABLE
The Cheese Train runs from January to October.TICKET
This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

name: Old Town of Montreux
abstract: The old town of Montreux lies on the hillside of the village. It is around 15 minutes' walk from the lakeshore and, with its cobbled streets and winegrowers' houses, is ideal for a discovery tour or starting point for hikes.
description:
And what a view opens up to the visitor here! Almost at every corner, a new panorama of lake, mountains and forests opens up to the observer. Especially from the forecourt of the St-Vincent church.

Small bistros and cafés invite you to linger. The old town is also the starting point for beautiful hikes, including the famous Chauderon Gorge. The hiking trail to the gorge leads along the Baye de Montreux river to Glion or Les Avants.

name: Christmas in Montreux
abstract: From the shores of Lake Geneva to the surrounding mountains, Festive Montreux (Montreux Noël) offers a great many activities in conjunction with the traditional Christmas Market.
description:
For a whole month the Christmas Market delights the round about 420,000 visitors and offers them a warm and hospitable welcome. 

A visit to the house of the real Father Christmas on the Rocher-de-Naye, a tour of discovery through an authentic Christmas village in Caux, a medieval market and a fairytale festival behind the lofty walls of legendary Chillon Castle: festive Montreux has a lot to offer in addition to the traditional Christmas Market.

More information: Christmas in Montreux [https://www.montreuxnoel.com/en-1-homepage.html]

name: Montreux Ice Rink - skating on the shores of Lake Geneva
abstract: This 300 m2 ice rink in the Montreux market hall may be used free of charge and is open from early January to mid-April.
description:
The ice rink is completely independent of temperature since it is made of synthetic materials, but still provides the feeling of being on real ice. Hence it may be used with the conventional materials and techniques. 

The ice rink is located in the market hall in the heart of Montreux. This historic, late 19th century lakeside architectural monument affords skaters a panoramic view of the Alps and Lake Geneva.

The pilots are all qualified and advise each client before the flight. They allow them to feel the pleasure of flying during this experience and always safely. It is the perfect location for a paragliding baptism. Easy takeoff and flight with a stunning view over Lake Geneva with Château de Chillon.

Her guided half or full-day paddleboard excursions take the group past Montreux, Clarens und Vevey. This is a chance to see the small towns from a different perspective. name: Balloon Flights over Château-d'Oex
abstract: Château-d'Oex is a hot-air balloon paradise!
description:
In the last week in January every year, Château-d'Oex provides the setting for an international spectacle, which is, in fact, the leading alpine ballooning event: the "Semaine Internationale de Ballons à Air Chaud" (International Hot Air Balloon Week) involves around 90 balloon pilots and is full of fascinating colours and shapes!

Opening hours:
All year round, the professional SkyEvent pilots are available to take you on a hot air balloon flight. It is a unique experience that you can try alone or with family or friends.

How to get to Chateau-d'Oex:
By car: take the A12 motorway, exit at Bulle, follow signs for Chateau-d'Oex. Alternatively, take the A9 motorway and exit at Aigle, then follow signs for Col des Mosses and make your way down to Chateau-d'Oex. From Simmental: take the A6 motorway, exit at Spiez then follow signs for Zweisimmen, Saanen and Gstaad, then Chateau-d'Oex. 
By train: take the MOB line from Montreux to Zweisimmen, via Rossiniere and Gstaad.

name: Dine on the move
description:
GOLDENPASS CLASSIC
The dining car is shaped like a wine barrel. Glass in hand, you’ll glide past the most beautiful parts of Switzerland, from Zweisimmen to Montreux, pampered by the chefs and indulged by the scenery. More Information... [http://www.mob.ch] 

THE SALON BLEU ON WHEELS
The Belle Époque comes to life in this dining car in the legendary style of the Orient Express. Enjoy anything from a glass of champagne to a multi-course menu. Also available for private events. More Information... [http://www.railaway.ch/Deutsch/Extrazug/extrazug_salonBleu.html ] 

FONDUE UP ON THE MOUNTAIN, OR DOWN ON THE LAKE
Fondue is always great fun – even more so when the setting is special. You can enjoy one on Mount Rigi [http://www.rigi.ch], the panoramic mountain high above Lake Lucerne, as you travel on the vintage electric cog wheel railway dating from 1911; or on one of the much-loved fondue cruises [http://www.railaway.ch/Deutsch/Publikumsfahrten/bodenseefahrten.html] on Lake Constance. 

A TASTY TRIP THROUGH GRAUBÜNDEN
Fresh, seasonal cuisine, great wines and fine brandies are all served in the Gourmino, the nostalgic 1930s dining car that travels the network of the Rhaetian Railways. A year-round calendar offers travellers treats ranging from just-picked asparagus to Buurametzgeta (farmhouse meal featuring a variety of cured meats) and seasonal game dishes. More Information... [http://www.rhb.ch]
BREAKFAST WITH BOND – AND OTHER PEAK PLEASURES
Scaling the mighty peaks of the Alps gives you quite an appetite – even when you make the ascent in a cable car or funicular. Thankfully, when you get to the top, there are special treats in store, like the James Bond Breakfast (daily until 11am) at the Piz Gloria revolving restaurant on the Schilthorn [http://www.schilthorn.ch], where “On Her Majesty’s Secret Service” was filmed; or creamy Älplermakkaroni (alpine macaroni and cheese) on the Stanserhorn [http://www.stanserhorn.ch]; or a stylish dinner on the Brienzer Rothorn [http://www.brienz-rothorn-bahn.ch] after a spectacular ride on Switzerland’s oldest steam-powered cog railway.
abstract: Travelling in style. The trip from Zermatt to St. Moritz/Davos on the Glacier Express is a treat for all the senses as is a gourmet ride on the Golden- Pass Line from the Bernese Oberland to Lucerne. These panoramic routes are among the finest railway experiences to be had anywhere in the world – thanks to the breathtaking views, and to the gastronomic delights served in the dining car. Pure pleasure, in a stunning setting.

name: Lac de Taney: Mountain Lake on the Haute-Savoie Border
abstract: This beautiful dark blue lake is surrounded by flower-strewn fields, tall, fragrant fir trees and rocks.
description:
The many flowers here include the alpine rose, monk's hood and mountain violet among others. Frogs croak on the shore and the shady forests nearby attract alpine salamanders. This is not surprising, since the Lac de Taney is well-known for attracting a vast number of amphibians.
This miniature paradise is located at an altitude of 1,500 m and overlooks the Rhone valley. It was declared a national natural heritage site in the Sixties, but thanks to the visionaries of the time, the lake was not exposed to mass tourism as originally planned. It can still be visited, however, and you can even stay in the charming little mountain inn on the Western shore of the lake.
The road leading to Lac de Taney is closed to private vehicles. Hike from Le Flon, the end station of the Swiss Post Bus line.

How to get there:
By car: drive from Montreux via Vouvry / Miex towards Lac de Taney, or use public transport to reach Miex (final hiking trail).

name: Hire a luxury sailing yacht for a dream cruise
abstract: Petite Arvine des Mers du Sud II is a Swiss-registered 38-foot (11m95 long, 3m98 wide) Beneteau Oceanis luxury monohull that can accommodate up to ten guests. To enjoy a cruise in the greatest comfort, the ideal number of passengers is between four and six.
description:
Sailing yacht of the year in 2016, it combines comfort with performance while guaranteeing peerless stability thanks to its deep keel (2m08) and 2.8-tonne bulb.

The yacht boasts two comfortable cabins (with box-spring beds), separate shower and WC, and a large saloon with a dining room and well-equipped kitchen (cooker, microwave, fridge).

Do you hold a sailing licence valid in Switzerland? Then you can be your own skipper after a short ad hoc training session on how to sail the yacht.
No licence or sailing experience? A volunteer skipper (with plenty of experience) will accompany you and teach you basic sailing manoeuvres so that you can try your hand in complete safety.

We will be delighted to prepare a barbecue for you on the rear deck. This deck is covered with a bimini, so that you can enjoy your meal sheltered from the sun/and or wind if necessary.

Each passenger – adult or child – will have life jacket at their disposal; life jackets are also available for small dogs. The rear deck opens up, making it easy to go for a swim. Paddle boards, snorkels, fins and lifebuoys are all available for you on board.

The organiser reserves the right to cancel the cruise in the event of adverse weather (storms, adverse winds, rain, etc).

Meeting point: Marina du Bouveret, Quai Cook (by the Canal Stockalper)


Typical programme

10:00 a.m. Meet at the Marina du Bouveret, Quai Cook
10:30 a.m. Pass through the swing bridge, sail, paddle board or swim in the middle of the lake on request Enjoy a glass of champagne or Petite Arvine, Morand syrups for children
12:45 p.m. Barbecue on board (merguez sausages, chicken, lamb chops) Salad, rice, oak-aged Merlot for four persons, mineral water, craft beer, cheese, Swiss Rock Café
01:45 p.m. Siesta on deck, sail towards Montreux and Chillon Castle
04:00 p.m. Return to Le Bouveret
05:00 p.m. Pass through the swing bridge, return to the Marina du Bouveret

Bookings
Petite Arvine des Mers du Sud II
Tel: +41 79 221 16 56
Email: pamsud@bm-s.ch

abstract: Raclette is one of Switzerland’s most iconic specialities. There’s no better way to enjoy this dish than in the great outdoors.
description: The breathtaking trip by the Montreux Oberland Bernois railway whisks you away from Vevey up to the Pléiades restaurant. This is just 200 metres from the railway station. Here, visitors will find everything they need to enjoy an outdoor raclette. The restaurant is also the starting point for numerous hikes. A hiking map will help you choose a route. The choice is almost endless: you can take a short stroll or a longer, more challenging hike.

description: The covered market is one of the main symbols of Montreux and was built between 1891 and 1892. Its metal structure is reminiscent of the famous Victor Baltard Halles in Paris and came from the same workshop that supplied Gustave Eiffel with the materials for his tower.

name: Ebenalp
abstract: Even the Neanderthals came here. Today, the cable car sweeps over the rugged rocks and once inhabited caves to the Ebenalp, the starting point for a wide range of discoveries.
description:
Wasserauen is the last stop on the Appenzell Railway. From there, the ultra-modern cable car carries passengers up the steep 723-metre climb to the Ebenalp (1,644 metres above sea level) in just six minutes.

From the upper station, the path leads down through the prehistoric Wildkirchli caves, which were inhabited around 40,000 years ago, then on to the hermit’s dwelling and the famous Berggasthaus Aescher mountain inn. Prehistoric stone tools were found in the area 100 years ago, evidence that the area was inhabited by hunter-gatherers during the Palaeolithic era (45,000 – 30,000 BC). The remains of cave bears were also found alongside the stone tools.

The Ebenalp is the ideal starting point for numerous easy to challenging hikes in the Alpstein massif. Taking in fragrant alpine meadows, impressive rock formations and magnificent lookout points, the hikes showcase the very best of the Appenzell region.INFORMATION
Altitude: 1,640 metres 
How to get there: Train to Appenzell and on to Wasserauen, cable car to the Ebenalp.
Views: To the Seealp and Meglisalp, Säntis, Altmann and Hoher Kasten, across the Appenzell region and Lake Constance to Germany and further west to the Feldberg 
Attractions: Alpine garden at the Berggasthaus Ebenalp mountain inn 
Food and drink: Hearty, home-style, Appenzell specialities 
Winter: Winter sports area with ski lifts on the Ebenalp 
Special comments: The secure path to the Aescher mountain inn passes through the caves
Discounted mountain ascent with Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets on arrival at the station.



DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=Ebenalp]

name: Säntis cable car
abstract: The journey in the big Säntis cable car from Schwägalp across the rocky ridges to the mountain station is an impressive experience in itself. And once you reach the “weather mountain”, the view of six different countries will take your breath away.
description:
The railway line to Wasserauen constructed at the beginning of the last century was actually the first section of a planned railway up the Säntis. The railway line never got further than the valley town, however, and so the cable car from Schwägalp to the top of the Säntis was opened in 1935. From the valley station, you glide almost weightlessly up to the imposing summit in around 10 minutes. At 2,502 metres above sea level, on clear days the mountain provides breathtaking views of France, Germany, Italy, Austria, Liechtenstein and Switzerland. 

The Säntis also plays a key role in weather forecasting – a weather station was first installed on the mountain way back in 1882. An experiential world brings the impressive natural phenomena and their elementary effects to life. A second experiential world – “Säntis – the Ice World” – was opened in 2020. Visitors learn all about snow, ice, ice crystals and glaciers through a series of fun activities and displays.

In summer, numerous special experiences such as full moon trips, sunrise ascents or Säntis-Spitzegnoss evenings attract visitors to the mountain.INFORMATION
Altitude: 2,502 m.a.s.l.
How to get there: Train to Urnäsch or Nesslau, PostBus to Schwägalp, cable car to the Säntis in 10 minutes
Views: Across the Appenzell region and the Alpstein mountain range to Lake Constance, Vorarlberg, the Graubünden Alps as far as the Bernina, in particular the Churfirsten range and beyond them the Tödi, Finsteraarhorn, Pilatus and Rigi, and across the Swiss Plateau to the Jura and Black Forest 
Attractions: Identify mountains and valleys from the viewing terraces, enjoy splendid sunrises and sunsets, full moon trips, a night on the Säntis 
Food and drink: Large, modern Säntisgipfel restaurant
Alter Säntis mountain inn (summer only) 
Accommodation: Alter Säntis mountain inn: Double and multi-bed rooms, dormitories (summer only) 
Hotel Schwägalp: Double rooms and tourist dormitories 
Groups: Rooms for events at the summit and at Schwägalp (extensive event brochure available online)
Alter Säntis has space for 90 guests (function room) 
Operating times: Säntis cable car runs all year round (brief closure for maintenance, usually in January/February, check the timetable [https://saentisbahn.ch/en/experience/cablecar/timetable/])
Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard: Discounted mountain ascent with Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard. Buy your tickets at the station
Special comments: Charter trips can be arranged outside of the normal timetable with advance notice



DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?nach=Säntis]

abstract: With about 7,000 inhabitants, Appenzell is the political, economic and cultural center of Appenzell Innerrhoden, the smallest Swiss canton.

Or choose a tour from our diverse array of offers, including a night watchman tour, a culinary village tour or a tasty town tour.

name: Appenzell craftsmanship
description: Erwin Fässler is a native of the Appenzell and familiar with the land and the people. He offers day tours and lets the guests arrange their own programme. They visit belt makers, painters, woodworkers, cheese makers, weavers and farmers to take a glimpse at the cultural landscape of the Appenzell region.

name: Kronberg – Mountain and valley in Appenzellerland
abstract: The cable car runs from the Jakobsbad station to the vantage point with its mountain guesthouse. Märliwelt, Zipline-Park and Bobbahn are just as famous as the view at the top, from the Hoher Kasten over the Säntis to the Lütispitz and across to the foothills of the Churfirsten range.
description:
Here you enjoy sweeping views from the Hohen Kasten above Säntis to the Lütispitz and across to the foothills of the Churfirsten range.

Leisurely tours include the 500m, pram-friendly summit walk and the ridge hike past St. James's chapel to the Scheidegg mountain guesthouse – as well as the less strenuous flower-rich trail down to the Schwägalp.

And additional adventure with the bob run or hanging loose (Tarzan style ) as you swing from tree to tree in the popular Zipline park. The enigma trail and the Märliwelt by the valley station make the Kronberg an attractive destination for families and groups.
Altitude: 1663m 
Accessibility: 
Appenzeller rail from Gossau/Herisau or from Appenzell to Jakobsbad, cable car to the Kronberg 
View: Alpstein, Leistchamm, Tödi, Glärnisch and Speer; Appenzell country as far as Lake Constance, Schaffhausen and eastern Switzerland region 
Attractions: Barefoot path to Gontenbad, bob run, zipline park, Märliwelt, the enigma trail
Culinary aspects: Kronberg breakfast buffets, Appenzeller Siedwurst mit Chäshörnli (boiled sausage with macaroni cheese) 
Overnight stays: Double and multi-bed rooms, 33 beds in the dormitory, 10 beds in bedrooms (weekends or on making a booking) 
Groups: Gaststube 130 people, Bistro 40 people; Seminar rooms in the "alten Berggasthaus" 
Winter: longest tobogganing run in the eastern part of Switzerland
Special comments: Solar power Kronberg

name: Kronberg bobsleigh run
abstract: Enjoy a fast ride on the 1,000 meter long Kronberg bob sled run.
description:
On the Kronberg bobsleigh track there is a fun packed ride for you! Take a seat alone or in pairs in a sled securely connected to the rails. After boarding, the path first leads you 450 metres upwards. Here you still have time to relax! Then it's up to you how fast you go, curve by curve, down the 1000-metre descent towards the valley. You decide the speed with the help of the brake lever.It's great fun for the entire family.
The bob sled run is open during summer season, weather permitting. Coming from Appenzell and going in the direction of Urnäsch, you will find Mt. Kronberg on the left-hand side.

name: Geological hiking path Alpstein
abstract: Thanks to its curious rock formations, the Alpsteinmassiv is considered one of the most attractive mountain ranges of Switzerland and a paradise for climbers and anyone interested in geology.
description:
A high altitude hiking trail follows the rib furthest south. The trail begins on the Hoher Kasten, (accessible via aerial cable-car from Brülisau) to the Saxerlücke and Bollenwees. 

The views from the 1800-meter Hohen Kasten encompass Lake Constance, the Vorarlberg Alps, the hilly Appenzell region and more. The 360° panorama is simply breathtaking. The views of the Rhine delta, the Kreuzberge Mountain and other sensational vistas like the "Hundstein, famous among climbers, accompany the hiker on the way to Saxerlücke. Return to Brülisau via Lake Sämtis (return to Bollenwees is also possible).

During the hike 20 orientation panels inform hikers about the creation of this mountain chain. One can see fossils, eroded structures, subterranean draining lakes, folds and fissures.
Hiking time is about three and a half hours, or six hours round trip to Brülisau.

culture_reason: The primary focus is on natural landscapes rather than cultural or historic elements.

name: Visitors’ Center Brauquöll Appenzell
abstract: Visitors obtain a lot of interesting information about the art of brewing on an exciting tour of Brauquöll Appenzell (Brewery Source Appenzell). The tour enables visitors to learn how Appenzell beer and Säntis Malt are created from fresh spring water.
description:
Brauerei Locher AG was purchased by the Locher family in 1886 and is the last remaining brewery in Appenzell Innerrhoden. A short film in the historic “Hops Cellar” gives viewers insight into the brewery’s operations and the small museum brings the past to life. 

Visitors participating in the tour receive audio equipment with commentary in German, English, French or Italian. Groups can arrange for an Appenzell beer tasting after the audio tour in the historic "Gnoss-Stöbli" (“Tasting Parlor”) – prior reservations are necessary. 

Sönd wöllkomm! – Welcome!

name: Visit to the Alpenbitter works
abstract: When 20-year-old Emil Ebneter started his Appenzell liquor shop in 1902, he laid the foundation for today’s Appenzeller Alpenbitter AG. Take the tour to gain clues to the secret of Appenzeller Alpenbitter.
description: During this guided tour you will not only learn about the secrets of the herb chamber but also all about how they malke what is undoubtedly the most famous Appenzeller. The free tour lasts approx. 1½ hours and includes tasting. Public guided tours are held all year, every Wednesday at 10.00 hrs.

name: Appenzellerland cross-country world
abstract: Sparse forests, snow-covered fields and moors, rolling hills and purest cross-country enjoyment is the best way to describe the surroundings of Appenzell’s Gais cross-country center.
description:
The cross-country area lies at 900 m altitude and is easily reached by either car or public transport. A more than 30-kilometer long trail, suitable for both classic cross-country skiing and skating, leads over meadows and moors of uniquely beautiful snowy landscapes here. And short climbs, easy descents and flat stretches offer plenty of variety.
Altitude: 960 meters above sea level. 
Classic trail: 32km 
Skating: 32km 
Night trail: 3km 
Dog trail:none

name: Puzzle Trail
abstract: With so many themed paths in the charming Appenzell region, hiking is even more eventful. The highlights include the Puzzle Trail in Schwellbrunn which requires both mental and physical fitness.
description:
In addition to the great Puzzle Trail, which is about 8.6 km long and more suitable for adolescents and adults, a shorter family puzzle path will also be available in 2017, focusing especially on children. Each of the two circular paths has 8 puzzle stations with new puzzles every year. Also, pleasant grilling stations with firewood, grill and seating and other unexpected attractions are available on both trails. Furthermore, by handing in their answers to the riddles, all puzzle hikers take part in the annual prize drawing.
Rätselweg Schwellbrunn [http://www.rätselweg.ch ]
nature_reason: The Puzzle Trail is primarily a nature trail with scenic hiking paths.
culture_reason: The focus is on hiking and puzzles, not cultural experiences.

name: Treetop path Neckertal
description:
Around 40 stops invite you to discover the trees, listen to the sounds of the forest, observe the woodland animals or simply relax. The viewing platform extends up over 50 metres from the ground. From here, visitors can enjoy a sweeping view of the entire Neckertal valley as far as Toggenburger Churfirsten and Appenzellerland. 

If you're craving a light snack, cold and warm dishes are offered in the self-service bistro. Around the treetop path, there are also facilities for active recreation and relaxation. A fitness trail, a log cabin, a forest adventure trail, BBQ areas, idyllic rest areas, a children’s playground and a dreamy natural pond. 

Treetop path Neckertal offers wheelchair-friendly parking, with further parking spaces just a 15 to 30-minute walk away. For visitors arriving by public transport, a 40-minute walk leads directly from Mogelsberg train station to Steinwäldli.
abstract: In Mogelsberg in the Toggenburg holiday region near St. Gallen, the first treetop path in Switzerland was opened in May 2018. The 500-metre disabled-accessible path gently winds from the forest floor into the treetops – a unique nature experience where visitors are at eye level with the flora and fauna.

name: From Säntis Malt to the Whisky Trek – follow the trail of the water of life
abstract: The Whisky Trek will undoubtedly set the pulse racing of any whisky collector or connoisseur. In fact, you can now upgrade a hike in beautiful surroundings or multiple tours in the Alpstein by adding that something extra for whisky lovers.
description:
Since May 2015, visitors to the Alpstein mountains in the Appenzell Alps can embark on the highest whisky trek in the world. The brainchild of the Locher brewery – famous for its Säntis Malt whisky – and the Bergwirte-Verein Alpstein (Alpstein mountain landlords’ association), the trek offers whisky-tasting like you’ve never experienced it before.Sepp Manser, landlord at the Berggasthaus Meglisalp mountain inn, came up with the idea of creating a whisky trek when he decided to serve up his own, unique version of Säntis Malt in 2012. His idea very swiftly became a reality – all 26 of the associated local mountain inns have now joined the trail, each with their very own barrel of whisky on hand for on-site tasting.Each of these barrels of whisky contains the same basic distillate, Säntis Malt made by the Locher brewery. But that’s where the similarity ends: Each of the barrels is unique, differing from the others in the type of wood used in its construction and its previous contents. The barrels are made from American, Portuguese, French or Russian oak, and were previously filled with desert wine, Merlot, Pinot noir, Sauvignon, Gamay, Zweigelt, port, sherry, rum, bourbon, damson schnapps or even beer. This diversity results in 26 totally unique flavours along the Appenzell Whisky Trek.Just seeing the barrels is an experience, not to mention the tasting of the whisky itself. As well as varying in flavour, the different whiskies each boast a different colour, with shades ranging from amber and white gold through to rose gold and deep copper.The exclusivity of the unique whiskies is upheld by ensuring that they are only available to taste in the individual mountain inn or to buy in small (1dl) or large (5dl) “one-of-a-kind” bottles, each signed personally by the “cask keeper” – the landlord.The Appenzell Whisky Trek has a brand-new attraction:
an exclusive new trophy that you can see and even wear! If you collect all 26 whiskies on the Alpstein whisky trek, you’ll be rewarded with a new “finisher trophy” – an original Appenzell belt with a genuine silver buckle, designed by Alpine saddler Roger Dörig. This reward replaces all previous collectors’ activities.
As of 25 June 2021, every 100ml bottle of whisky you buy now comes with a “Fass-Bon”, or “barrel token”, which can be detached and stuck into the Whisky Trek collector’s pass. Once your pass is full, you will be rewarded with an exclusive leather belt featuring a genuine silver buckle, crafted by artisan leatherworker Roger Dörig (valued at CHF 350). You can choose the colour and length of your belt. The Whisky Trek belt buckle is only available as a Whisky Trek trophy and is not available for purchase. The campaign will run until the end of the 2023 season
The collector’s pass is available from participating mountain inns and from the Locher brewery’s “Brauquöll” visitors’ centre on Brauereiplatz in Appenzell. The belt can also be ordered there, or from Roger Dörig’s shop.
Old, expired Whisky Trek coupons are no longer valid but can be exchanged for a free 100ml bottle in the “Brauquöll” centre. The centre also still sells the decorative 9-bottle wooden storage shelf, which can be used to display your collection of treasures.We hope you enjoy this true feast for the senses in the Alpstein mountains, where the whisky is as breathtakingly unique as the surrounding scenery.


More information:
www.whiskytrek.com [http://www.saentismalt.com/en/whiskytrek.html] www.alpstein.ch [http://www.alpstein.ch]INFORMATION

name: The unsung heroines of Urnäsch
abstract: The special “Intensive Times - Women and Customs” show depicts the role of women farmers, from the alpine ascent to New Year’s Eve celebrations.
description: Women do not generally play a main role in the customs of Appenzell Ausserrhoden. From an outsider’s perspective, their contribution is barely visible. Very few people get the chance to hear the heartfelt call of the farmer’s wife to her husband as she sets off on the alpine ascent. Eight women of Urnäsch provide the focus in the special exhibition in the Museum of Appenzeller Traditions in Urnäsch. On the guided tour, the visitors learn how the women in Urnäsch experience alpine ascents, cattle shows, New Year’s Eve celebrations and Urnäsch string music, as well as many other surprising facts.

name: Gonten Barefoot Trail
abstract: This barefoot trail takes you across the Gonten moor to the Kronbergbahn valley station. Experience first-hand the unique sensations of barefoot hiking.
description:
You will be surprised at just how rich this tactile experience is. Meadows and streams are connected by short stretches of cobblestone or asphalt. 

At the beginning and end, Kneipp stations in a mountain stream make it easy for you to wash your feet. Halfway along the trail, at the Toobeschopf Museum, there is a Kneipp arm bath for your use.

name: Lugano – Monte San Salvatore
abstract: Monte San Salvatore in Lugano offers unique views over Lake Lugano, the Alps and the Po Valley. The funicular takes you to the summit in 12 minutes, where hiking trails, a viewing platform, a museum and a restaurant serving Ticino specialties await you.
description:
Monte San Salvatore in Lugano is a top destination for nature lovers and hiking enthusiasts. The funicular railroad takes you quickly and easily from Paradiso to the summit. From the viewing platform, you can enjoy a magnificent view over Lake Lugano, the Alps and as far as the Po Valley.

In the San Salvatore Museum, you can learn exciting facts about the geology and history of the region. Popular hiking trails lead from here to Carona or Morcote. Climbing fans will also get their money's worth on Monte San Salvatore.

The Ristorante Vetta serves typical Ticino dishes, perfect for a break with a view. The mountain is an experience all year round and ideal for a day trip.
nature_reason: The primary focus is on scenic viewpoints and hiking trails with views over Lake Lugano and the Alps.
culture_reason: While there is a museum, the main attraction is the natural landscape and views.
food_reason: The restaurant is mentioned, but it is not the primary focus of the attraction.

name: Monte Generoso
abstract: At the southern end of Lake Lugano is the 1,704 metre high Monte Generoso. This lofty altitude makes it without a doubt the best mountain for views in the canton of Ticino.
description:
The new restaurant “Fiore di pietra” (stone flower) created by the famous architect Mario Botta stands majestically on a rugged plateau on the mountain. Its windows offer breathtaking 360° panoramic views, taking in the lakes, the city of Lugano as well as the Matterhorn and Jungfrau all the way to the Bernina Range.

Nostalgic journey to the summit
A cog railway has been taking visitors up to the peak of Monte Generoso for 125 to enjoy these breathtaking views. It is about 9km long and runs along a magical stretch of mountain scenery in the Monte Generoso nature park. In addition to electric trains, nostalgic modes of transport also use this cog railway line, including the oldest steam train still in operation in Switzerland, built in 1890, and trains from the 1950s. A ride in these trains brings the time of the Belle Époque back to life.

Activities on and around the mountain
There is much to discover on Monte Generoso: Keen hikers can explore the mountain on more than 51km of hiking trails. The Nature Trail and the Ice Pits Nevere are just two of the many hiking paths. The Ice Pits Nevere trail takes hikers to restored ice huts, which were once used to chill milk before it was churned into butter. The brave can marvel at the landscape around Monte Generoso from the air by paragliding from the top. Flights start on Monte Generoso and glide in different directions over the lakes, countryside and towns.

INFORMATION
How to get there:
Drive or take public transportation from Lugano to Capolago-Riva San Vitale, from there take the Monte Generoso mountain train to the top of Monte Generoso.

Sunset:
If you get a chance, don’t miss the sunset in Ticino. It’s a truly spectacular experience.

Food/drink:
The “Fiore di pietra” gourmet restaurant and “Generoso” self-service restaurant will satisfy your hunger and thirst after a leisurely stroll or strenuous hike.

Families:
The “Bear Cave” is about 30 minutes from the “Fiore di pietra” building on the Italian side of the mountain. Some 60,000 years ago, it was home to more than 800 cave bears. The cave's length is 200m, 70m of which have been made accessible to visitors. You need sturdy shoes, hiking gear and a hat to follow in the footsteps of the cave bears.

Please note:
Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass / GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets on arrival at the station.

More information about Monte Generoso [https://www.montegeneroso.ch/en]

name: Monte Tamaro
abstract: The Monte Tamaro lies in the triangle between Lugano, Bellinzona and Locarno. It is famous for the Santa Maria degli Angeli church designed by Mario Botta and the scenic ridge walk from Monte Lema.
description:
Leaving from Rivera, the cable car climbs to Alpe Foppa [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/food-wine/restaurant/restaurant-alpe-foppa/]at 1,530 metres. The telecommunications mast is a good 300 metres higher, while the actual Tamaro summit is 1,962 metres above sea level. On a clear day you can see the Monte Rosa Massif from the summit and on the Lema hike. There are hiking routes in all directions, and mountain bikers love the downhill routes and the bike park.

The mountain restaurant, the summer toboggan run, the zip wire, the large children’s playground at the upper station and the adventure high ropes park [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/suspension-rope-park-of-the-monte-tamaro/]at the middle station combine to make Monte Tamaro a mountain packed with adventure. The Splash & Spa Tamaro [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/splash-e-spa-aquapark/]in Rivera, a water park spread across more than 10,000 square metres, is also a real delight for water babies.

Altitude: 1,962 metres 
How to get there: Train from Lugano [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/lugano/]or Bellinzona [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/bellinzona/]to Rivera-Bironico, 15-minute walk to the valley station, two-stage cable car to Alpe Foppa (1,530 metres) 
Views: To the north across the Magadino plain to Bellinzona, the Ticino mountains to the Gotthard region and the Bernese Oberland; to the south-east the Dent della Vecchia and Monte Generoso [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/monte-generoso-and-valle-di-muggio/]
Attractions: Church of Santa Maria degli Angeli [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/cappella-santa-maria-degli-angeli/]by Mario Botta, paintings by Enzo Cucchi, summer toboggan run, long zip wire, large playground, adventure park (middle station) 
Food and drink: Alpe Foppa self-service restaurant with seating for 400 
Accommodation: Capanna Tamaro UTOE mountain hut (next to the mast, one hour from Alpe Foppa): 53 sleeping spaces 
Groups: Alpe Foppa: meeting room, seating for 140, traditional cuisine, mainly Ticino specialities such as Ticino polenta with two types of cheese [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/food-wine/polenta-ticinese/]
Winter: Closed 
Special comments: Splash & Spa Tamaro water park in Rivera (open all year around)
Discounted mountain ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/swiss-travel-pass/]/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets on arrival at the station.

name: Monte San Giorgio
abstract: Its summit offers up magnificent views and those inclined to scratch about on it will be left with the impression that marine fauna and other large animals once lived here.
description:
The Monte San Giorgio is the Swiss saurian mountain; it has gained in prominence as a transnational locality since 2010 when the UNESCO extension also took in the Italian side of the mountain. 

This mountain has a truly rich inner life: rising just under 1100 metres in height, the Monte San Giorgio in the sunny south of Ticino has been a Mecca for fossil scientists since the 19th century, and a Unesco World Heritage site since 2003. Thousands of fossilised fish and marine saurians of up to six metres in length have already been unearthed here by eager palaeontologists. And for good reason: 230 to 245 million years ago, this was the site of a 100-metre-deep ocean basin. Today, at the southern end of Lake Lugano, the Monte San Giorgio rises like a pyramid – inside, filled with all manner of fossils. One can stroll through the vineyards along the southern slopes of the woody mountain, saunter through the idyllic town of Meride, or allow oneself to be pampered in the grottos of the Mendrisiotto region. 

Around 80 different species of fish and 30 marine and land reptiles have been discovered at the numerous excavation sites. What’s more, the scientists have also found hundreds of fossilised invertebrate animals and plants from the middle Triassic period, 230 to 245 million years ago. 

Remodeled and expanded by the Ticinese architect Mario Botta, the Fossil Museum in Meride exhibits a selection of fossilized animals and plants from the unique UNESCO World Heritage Site of Monte San Giorgio.

name: Monte Lema
abstract: Monte Lema is situated between Lake Lugano and Lake Maggiore. At 1,624 metres above sea level, the mountain towers above the Malcantone region and offers panoramic views across southern Ticino and beyond. Monte Lema is the starting point for numerous hikes and bike tours, but also offers culinary highlights and unique views of the stars.
description:
Not far from the town of Lugano, in the heart of the Malcantone region, Monte Lema rises to the sky. Easily accessible by cable car, the panoramic view from the upper station is unrivalled. The view extends from the rolling, densely wooded hills of Malcantone with its chestnut forests and picturesque villages to the town of Lugano. If you walk 10 minutes from the upper station to the peak on a clear day, you will be rewarded with a view of the Bernese and Valais Alps.

The restaurant is accessible via a barrier-free path. A spacious terrace and two cosy dining rooms in the restaurant invite you to linger. Typical Ticino dishes are served, ranging from polenta to the famous torta di pane (bread cake). There are also 22 simple beds available in the guest house. A night on the summit is unforgettable.

It is just a short walk from the restaurant to the observatory. During a guided tour, guests can immerse themselves in the vastness of the universe. The stars suddenly seem so much closer. Numerous events are held on Monte Lema during the summer too. For example, a moonlit hike or yoga with a view.

Monte Lema is also the starting point for numerous hikes. Around 80 kilometres of hiking trails are waiting to be discovered. Leisurely circular hikes are ideal for hours of enjoyment. If you are looking for a greater challenge, you can undertake the famous ridge hike to Monte Tamaro. Impressive views are guaranteed. Bikers can expend their excess energy on a wide variety of trails.

Getting there: Take the train from Bellinzona or Lugano to Lamone-Cadempino, bus directly to Miglieglia, cable car to Monte Lema.

DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=MonteLema]

name: Ciani Park
abstract: Located on the shores of Lake Lugano, this 63,000 square metre park constitutes the city’s green lung. Here you can recover from the hustle and bustle of the city as you walk along paths lined by magnificent centuries-old trees.
description:
The paths wind through beautiful flower beds, lined with statues and fountains, and are framed by the meticulously manicured English lawn. The park is divided into two areas. The first area in the vicinity of the Villa Ciani can be reached through the main entrance at the end of the waterside promenade. This area has both the features of an Italian and an English garden: lush flower beds alternate with green spaces and trees and shrubs from all over the world. 

The second area extends from the jetty to the Cassarate River and has a "wilder" and more original character. Here you will find oak, lime, plane and maple trees, all typical representatives of the Ticino forests. Within this forested area there is a children's playground with numerous games for children of all ages. 

The Parco Ciani is also home to various buildings: the Villa Ciani, the Convention Centre, a jetty, the Natural History Museum and the Cantonal Library.

abstract: The Lugano swimming resort "Lido", a place which everyone loves in Lugano, has managed to preserve its attractiveness and charm throughout years.

name: Lugano Urban Discovery
abstract: With Mediterranean flair, Lugano offers all the advantages of a world-class city combined with the cachet of a small town.
description:
Go for a stroll to explore the city and enjoy local beers, wine and ice cream. Those who love a dose of culture can learn more about local products during a 2.5-hour tour in a friendly and cosy atmosphere. 
 * Open all year
 * Open every day
 * Min. of 10 to max. of 30 people
 * CHF 40 per person


More information [https://www.luganoregion.com/en/attractions-activities/day-trips-surroundings/detail/id/48274/urban-discovery-more]

name: Lugano - Unexpected Classic Tour
abstract: Past and present: this exceptional tour through classical Lugano is packed with surprises for visitors. Historic figures appear along the way, presenting scenes from the past in entertaining ways.
description: This guided walking tour is accompanied by two actors who take on the role of historical characters as they tell the story of the city, bringing the spirit of each era vividly to life. The itinerary takes in a number of historical monuments as well as modern buildings by internationally famous Ticino architects. The “Unexpected Classic Tour” takes place every Monday and is free of charge.

name: Explore street art in Lugano
abstract: This self-guided tour allows you to discover Lugano from the perspective of its street art.
description:
The Lugano Street Art Tour gives you the opportunity to explore numerous public works of art that have been created by AUL (Arte Urbana Lugano) and other private institutions over the years. The tour opens up a new and unusual side of Lugano that often goes unnoticed,

covering both the city centre and beyond. In addition to artworks in the city centre, the tour also explores hidden gems off the beaten tourist path, including in the small village of Bré on Monte Bré with its historic rural architecture and Sorengo with its futuristic new buildings.

All you need for the tour are a comfortable pair of shoes and the free Street Art Guide Lugano, which you can print out or open as a PDF on your smartphone or tablet.

name: A visit to Parco Ciani, Lugano's most beautiful park
abstract: Did you know that Lugano boasts a unique Mediterranean-style climate that allows olive trees, cork oaks and palm trees to flourish side-by-side? Parco Ciani is a sprawling park in exquisite surrounds featuring lakefront views, ambling paths & manicured lawns.
description:
A stroll through Lugano’s parks and gardens offers visitors a chance to enjoy the city’s lush greenery, and discover exotic plants and flowers as well as local varieties. The walk begins at the church of Santa Maria degli Angioli, leads through the Belvedere gardens and ends in the Parco Civico-Ciani, the city’s largest park and one of the most important in the whole of Switzerland. 

On one of Ticino’s many gloriously sunny days, nothing beats exploring Lugano’s parks and gardens, ice cream in hand, while enjoying the breathtaking scenery and the delightful Mediterranean climate

abstract: With numerous entertainments and events, the Christmas holidays are a fabulous time to spend in Lugano.

A magical world for children, which even adults love to partake in. The joy of being together, without necessarily having to stay in one’s home living room. The pleasure of buying presents at the market or in boutiques. 

This is the kind of Christmas that the City proposes and which will feature 37 very special days in the streets of the city centre so that the Christmas season can reach out to everyone.

name: Foxtrail – fun in Lugano
abstract: In Lugano, the fox takes chasers across the entire Mediterranean-style town. You'll search for secret treasure and will need to rescue knights, decipher ancient lettering and follow traces of blood.
description: The fox has laid its trails. Secret messages, hidden clues and many tricky and perplexing challenges show you the way from one stop to the next. You are out on the trail by yourself and never know what’s waiting in store for you – even people familiar with the region are bound to discover new things. The Foxtrail takes you through towns and countryside on foot and using various means of transport. The trails last between 1.5 and 4.5 hours. All you’ll need is good shoes and a mobile phone per group in case you need to call the hotline. Pricing depends on your age and the length of the trail. Simply book online through the website, print the starting instructions and enjoy solving the puzzles!

name: ArtiChoke urban art route
abstract: A unique route awaits visitors in the heart of the medieval town of Estavayer-le-Lac: the urban art route includes 15 works by artists from a wide variety of disciplines, that are consistently based on modern and contemporary art.
description:
Strolling between historic facades and Lake Neuchâtel while discovering original artworks becomes a reality on the ArtiChoke route in Estavayer-le-Lac [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/estavayer-le-lac/]. The highly accessible open-air gallery offers a thematic tour that is in stark contrast to the medieval town. Please allow a little more than an hour for your visit. The tour is self-guided using a map that can be downloaded or collected at no charge from the town’s tourist office. And if you would like to find out more about the artists, you can also book a guided tour.

The route brings together some fifteen works [https://www.fribourgregion.ch/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/estavayer-262900-brochuere-artichoke.pdf] that have been painted, modelled, shaped or produced using other techniques at various sites around the historic town. Swiss and international artists bring to life diverse and sometimes offbeat worlds.

One of the facades along the Grand-Rue has been decorated by Spanish artist Raquel Rodrigo, using an embroidery technique that is popular worldwide. You can also discover an impressive work made up of 788 origami works by French artist Mademoiselle Maurice. These urban artists have taken over a wall in Switzerland for the first time, where they will be presenting works created specifically for the tour.

The ArtiChoke Festival [https://www.artichokefestival.ch]is held in Estavayer-le-Lac every two years, in the summer. Art lovers and curious newcomers will not come away from the event disappointed. The programme includes live painting, musical animations, audiovisual performances, temporary exhibitions and culinary offerings with various food trucks.

More information [https://www.fribourgregion.ch/en/estavayer-payerne/visits/artichoke-itinerary-of-urban-art/] about the tour.

What is the meaning behind the name “ArtiChoke”? The word comes from a combination of the words “art” and “choc”, the French word for “shock”. It alludes to the clash of medieval walls with contemporary urban art. A name that stands out and surprises.

name: Stoosbahn, the steepest funicular railway in the world
abstract: At the very heart of Switzerland, a world record-holding technical innovation awaits: the steepest funicular railway in the world leads from Schwyz up to the car-free mountain village of Stoos. The journey there is an experience in itself, with passengers being taken up to a natural paradise 1,300 metres up.
description:
The technical marvel will delight guests of all ages: the Stoosbahn reaches a gradient of 110% (47 degrees). It is the steepest funicular railway in the world. What’s really fascinating is that the spherical cabins adapt to the gradient perfectly. This enables passengers to stay upright at all times.

The journey from Schwyz to Stoos takes between 4 and 7 minutes. In the process, the Stoosbahn covers a total ascent of around 744 metres, and travels over two bridges and through three tunnels. After 1,740 metres, the funicular reaches the upper station in the middle of the mountain village. A natural paradise awaits with a wide range of leisure activities.

The holiday village of Stoos [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/stoos/], sitting at about 1,300 metres up, can be found nestled in the Alpine landscape of Central Switzerland. There is a wide range of leisure activities on offer: from a hike along the ridge trail with impressive plunging views to fun in the water at the Little Stoos Lake or a leisurely picnic. Here, everyone will find the experience to suit them. In winter, ski slopes, winter hiking trails and snowshoe trails delight guests.

Getting there: From Schwyz train station, buses take about 20 minutes to reach the “Stoosbahn” bus stop. Alternatively, take the car from Schwyz in the direction of Muotathal. The valley station and large car park is located directly on the road.


INFORMATION
Gradient 110% (47.73 degrees) Altitude difference 744 metres Length 1,740 metres Duration Between 4 and 7 minutes Timetable Runs all year round, in line with the timetable [https://stoos-muotatal.ch/en/train/stoos-railways/] Special comments Fully included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) / GA Travelcard.

name: Fronalpstock viewing platform
abstract: The striking viewing platform above Brunnen can be easily reached by chair lift from car-free Stoos. Gaze across the arms of Lake Lucerne to the Black Forest.
description:
The summit of the Fronalpstock boasts an unbeatable 360° panoramic view. Among the sights are the Glarus mountains Glärnisch and Tödi, Uri Rotstock, the central Swiss mountains Pilatus and the two Mythen, Solothurn’s local mountain, the Weissenstein and, across the border, the Vosges. The wide vista of ten lakes and the view down into Rütli, the Uri Reuss Valley and Lucerne are impressive.

The cosy and rustic summit restaurant as well as easy walks on the viewing plateau are ideal for connoisseurs. Children can stroke the mountain goats. The spacious playground is the ideal spot for fun and games with a spectacular view. Starting out from the Klingenstock chair lift, sure-footed hikers can reach the Fronalpstock via the well-developed, spectacular ridge path, which is partly secured by chains. The descent crosses alpine meadows - past Laui Alpine Farm - back to Stoos.

Tip: The peak experience ticket [https://www.stoos.ch/en/pages/planen-buchen] is the ideal way to discover the Stoos area. Hikers, walkers and connoisseurs can use all cable cars and mountain railways in the area without restrictions for one day. For families, children with the SBB junior travelcard or children’s co-travelcard can travel for free. 

Altitude: 1,922m Accessibility: Take the train to Schwyz, bus via Schwyz (centre) to Schwyz (Schwyz, Stoosbahn) and funicular to Stoos; or train to Brunnen, bus to Morschach (Morschach, Luftseilbahn) and cable car to Stoos; chair lifts to the Fronalpstock and the Klingenstock Views: The two Mythen peaks, Glarus, Uri Alps and Reuss Valley, Lake Lucerne and Rigi Attractions: Ridge hike from the Klingenstock to the Fronalpstock, summit walks on the Fronalpstock, the Stoos moorlands, Little Stoos Lake and the surrounding area Winter: Stoos-Fronalpstock and Klingenstock winter sports resort Special highlight: A visit to the Alpine restaurant (Laui Alpine Farm), ride on the steepest funicular in the world
The Swiss Travel Pass covers the entire fare as far as Stoos. Buy your mountain railway ticket for the Fronalpstock on site.


DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return mountain railway return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?nach=Fronalpstock]

name: Photo Spot Einsiedeln Abbey
abstract: The abbey of Saint Meinrad in Einsiedeln has attracted pilgrims for over 1,000 years. It was rebuilt over the centuries and, today, the 18th century baroque-style monastery forms the impressive centre of Einsiedeln. Besides the ‘Chapel of Mercy’ with its famous ‘Black Madonna’, the complex includes a high school, winery and stables for horse breeding. Attracted by the beautiful scenery and a variety of concerts, many nature and culture lovers enjoy visiting Einsiedeln.

name: Tectonic Arena Sardona
abstract: Knife-sharp and yellow: The seldom line along the rock face around the Piz Sardona marks the Glarus overthrust - a phenomenon of world interest. Here, older rock strata have edged their way above younger rocks.
description:
Few places illustrate the history of the Alps as impressively as the UNESCO World Heritage Site between the Murgsee lake, Pizol and Martin's Hole near Elm. Unique formations bear witness to the awesome power of nature when the continents of Africa and Europe collided. 

Clearly visible from a great distance: the distinctive notch around the Piz Sardona separates the 250-million-year-old Verrucano rock from the 35 to 50 million years “young” Flysch rock. Extraordinary is that ancient stone formations overlie those that are millions of years younger - which was long an enigma for geologists, and a fact so unique that led it to the addition of the Swiss Tectonic Arena Sardona on the UNESCO World Heritage list in 2008. 

The Glarus overthrust, particularly attractive to discover around the Martin’s Hole, forms the heart of the 300 square meter Sarganserland- Walensee-Glarnerland Geopark. 

EXCURSION TIP:“EXPEDITION TSCHINGLEN”
The excursion begins on the gondola lift from Elm to the Tschinglen Alp – right through the awe-inspiring gorge. In the gondola you will hear an exciting audio guide about the history of the Tectonic Arena. The Alp is the departure point for an approx. 1 ½ hour circular hike to the Firstboden viewpoint. The panorama extends from Martinsloch across Martinsmad and Mittagshorn down to the deep-cut valley floor.

name: Lake Zug Cruises
abstract: Right at the very heart of Central Switzerland, shared by cantons Zug, Schwyz and Lucerne, lies Lake Zug - Switzerland’s tenth largest lake.
description:
Surrounded by lovely hills, this picturesque region offers a great variety of hiking, biking and skating trails. All of these can be perfectly combined with a culinary excursion on Lake Zug, for example on the Sushi Cruise, the Dessert Cruise or the Crêpes Cruise.

FACTS
Route: Zug – Arth
Distance: Length of the lake 13.7 km
Duration: approx. 1h
EXCURSION TIPS
 * Zugerberg – magnificent view onto mountains and lakes 
 * Animal Park Goldau – wild animals up close on 34 hectares of natural habitat 
 * Höllgrotten Baar – a unique stalactite cave with fairytale dropstone formations 
 * Einsiedeln Monastery – home of roughly 50 monks
 * Aeschbach Chocolatier 

FOOD & BEVERAGES
Catering services available in the boat restaurants.TIMETABLE
Lake Zug Cruises operate from April to October.
All connections here [https://www.zugersee-schifffahrt.ch/en/scheduled-cruises-travel-info/timetable/]TICKET
This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]
RESERVATIONS
No seat reservation required – free seating.

name: Photo Spot Grosser Mythen
abstract: Exactly 47 hairpin bends lead to the Grosser Mythen, here also referred to as ‘Matterhorn of Central Switzerland’. Every year, around 30,000 hikers enjoy the breathtaking panorama at 1,898 m.a.s.l. (6,227 ft). The view into the valley shows ‘Old Schwyz’, the cradle of the Swiss Confederacy, with Lake Lucerne in the south as well as lakes Lauerz and Zug with Rigi and Rossberg to the west. It comes at no surprise that the Schwyz landmark has been immortalised as a mural in the National Council Chamber of the Federal Palace.

The guests are gathering strength in the wellness programme and end the day with dinner and a nice glass of wine.

name: Hölloch Parcours
abstract: Exciting and adventurous short expedition in one of the largest cave systems in the world (over 200 kilometres have been explored).
description:
Immerse yourself in the fascinating cave world and learn from our guides about the history of Hölloch, its origins, as well as the rock types and cave dwellers. Experience what true darkness is when you extinguish all light and enjoy the acoustics of the cave with its many different sounds. An intense cave experience and a real adventure that you will rave about for a long time!

The exciting tour takes you through various corridors of the cave system, which the first Hölloch researchers discovered more than a hundred years ago with hobnail boots and candle lanterns. It is a small expedition, which means that you cannot always walk upright; at times you will have to climb, crawl, go up and down a ladder, or even slip through a narrow area. But don't worry. It's not too tight and the tour is easy to handle even with a normal level of physical fitness.

Arrival: By car: Parking near Restaurant Hölloch, Stalden 15, 6436 Muotathal. 
By public transport: By train to Schwyz then bus no. 1 to the stop “Hölloch, Muotathal”
To bring with you: warm socks. Also bring old, robust clothes (jeans, pullovers, fleece jacket); alternatively, cave overalls can be rented on site for CHF 25.
Suitable for families (children from age 9), couples, individuals. Groups of six or more can set their own entry time to the caves.

name: Muotathal’s Weatherman Hiking Trail
abstract: The Weatherman Hiking Trail in the Muotathal Valley shows at 14 stations how, based on the signs of nature, weather rules are made to predict sun, wind, and rain.
description:
Weatherman hiking is about enjoying the company of fellow hikers, observing nature and returning home enriched by a wonderful experience. Two different routes are available: the short route of about one hour, and the longer, two-hour route which offers the opportunity for a refreshing drink at the mountain pub “Guggeli-Besenbeiz”. 
The inventors of the Weatherman Hiking Trail, the “Wetterschmöcker” (Weather Tasters/Forecasters) of Central Switzerland, are known beyond the country’s borders. Although they are sometimes ridiculed, their work should be taken seriously: With a success rate of up to 80%, their predictions are much better than random guesses.

name: Activities in Sattel-Hochstuckli
abstract: The family mountain with revolving gondola lift, "Stuckli-Run" summer toboggan run, tubing run, Skywalk pedestrian suspension bridge, bouncy castle and scooter trekking are the highlights here.
description:
On the ride to Mostelberg, the colorful 8-seater gondola turns twice on its own axis. Children like to stay at the mountain station, as Rondo's children's world offers almost everything a child's heart desires with its toboggan run, tubing run and numerous bouncy castles and trampolines.

The "Skywalk" foot suspension bridge is 374 m long and one of the longest pedestrian suspension bridges in Europe, crossing the Lauitobel at a height of 58 m. If you don't want to experience the bridge a second time on the way back, take a hike in the direction of Herrenboden, Hochstuckli or Rothenthurm.

Views: From Mostelberg: to the Rigi mountain range, Wildspitz, Lake Aegeri with Morgarten, the Rotenthurm area; from Hochstuckli also the Mythen, the Schwyz basin with Lakes Lauerz and Lucerne, Central Switzerland and the Bernese Alps.
Attractions: Revolving gondola, pedestrian suspension bridge, Rondo's children's world, Geissä Wäg theme and adventure trail, Mythen round trip and panoramic circular hiking trails, high-altitude hike to Haggenegg

name: One of the longest toboggan runs in central Switzerland
abstract: Also non-skiers get their fill of enjoyment on the Klewenalp; as a fantastic toboggan run leading from the Klewenalp via the Stockhütte and on down to Emmeten passes through some truly magical winter scenes on the way.
description:
Starting point for this toboggan run is up on the Klewenalp where, following a short march, the fun begins with rides around the Klewenstock and on down to Aengi. And a short climb up to the Twäregg is not only rewarded with beautiful views over the Schwyzer Mythen and Brunnen, instead a great descent through the winter woods and on down to Stockhütte.

name: Historical route by canoe
description: The trip to the ship trading route of the old Swiss starts in the harbor of Brunnen. The visitors paddle their canoe across Lake Lucerne and stop to visit the site where Switzerland was founded: the Rütli. The excursion is guided by an expert and lasts two hours at most.

name: Winter canoeing tours on Lake Uri
abstract: Gliding over the still waters of Lake Uri – the southern end of Lake Lucerne – in a canoe is a truly magical experience in winter. This tour, which is for groups of at least three people, sets out from Brunnen to explore the fjord-like landscape.
description:
The ice crystals glisten and bare branches rise out of the water while the snow-covered Mythen are forever in the background as paddlers glide along on their two-hour tour. Protected against the cold and wrapped up warmly in special, insulated suits and warm clothing, you will take to the waters with an experienced guide. An adventure of a special kind.

More information [https://www.erlebnisregion-mythen.ch/de/buchen/erlebnisangebote/winterangebote/kanu-wintertouren/]

abstract: Visit the "Maskengarderobe" and discover the origin of the traditional carnival figures of Schwyz.
description:
The villages in the canton of Schwyz celebrate Carnival in their own fashion – with masks unique to each village. 
The traditional carnival costumes and masks are stored here. Some of the carnival figures date back to the 18th and 19th century. Some have their origin in the Venitian Carnival.Today one can rent the costumes for carnival. 
The listed price is an indication price for a group of 15 people.

name: To the shepherd
description: In the canton of Schwyz, the sheep are closest to the sky at the top of Muota Valley. The excursion to the Glattalp plateau at 1,800m starts with a cable car. The guided walk then passes over the alpine meadows up to a traditional alpine hut, which is surrounded by thousands of grazing sheep and goats. After lunch, the group will return to the valley accompanied by the alpine guide.

name: Sunny slope
abstract: Views at the start of this sunny piste extend over ten Swiss lakes and vertically down to the Rütli meadow; spectacular to say the least, with the majority of wide and easy slopes also offering a glimpse of the Mythen mountain range as you make your way down.
description:
At the Stoos heights, winter sports enthusiasts find versatile slopes, fast sledding and airboard fun, scenic cross country trails, diverse winter hiking and snowshoe trails, along with many a cosy mountain hut. The start to these broad and sunny pistes lies at 1922 m on the Fronalpstock summit, which is conveniently reached with the comfortable 4-seater chairlift. And on reaching the top you have beautiful views over Lake Lucerne, the Schwyz basin and Mythen mountains. Separate sledding and airboard runs bid fast fun aside the same slopes - and from the middle Mettlen station you spot the idyllic car-free mountain village of Stoos. Rock bottom, at the valley station of the chairlift, two cosy restaurants, kid’s ski country (Kinderskiland) with magic carpet and a sports store with possible rentals also please all. 
Starting point: Fronalpstock Gipfel (1922 m a.s.l.)

Accessibility of starting point: chairlift

Destination: Stoos (1320 m a.s.l.)

Length: 6.5 km

Altitude difference: 600 Meter

Gradient: 25% (average), 60% (maximum)

Level of difficulty: intermediate (normal slope)

Food and beverages: at the start, on the way, at the finish (Gipfelrestaurant Fronalpstock, Pistenrestaurant Welesch, Restaurant Alpstubli & Restaurant zum Pasta Gadä)

name: Exclusive collection of flags with flag-waving course
abstract: Visitors hear about the six-hundred-year history that is behind the flags and participate in one of the country’s oldest customs.
description:
A day dedicated to the topic of flags: In the Federal Charter Museum in Schwyz, participants learn about the history of historical flags from famous battles such as the Sempach or Morgarten battles. In the afternoon they get to know one of the oldest customs in the Alps up close - flag waving. The participants try their hand during a few of the 46 turns, aided by an experienced course leader. Reservations are required.
Further information on flag waving [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/about-switzerland/customs-traditions/customs-and-sports/flag-throwing-under-the-spell-of-the-banner.html]

name: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
abstract: The Zermatt Bergbahnen AG take visitors right to Europe’s highest mountain station – at amazing 3883 metres.
description:
The panoramic view over the largest glaciers of the Alps and over no fewer than 38 breathtaking giants of the Swiss, French and Italian Alps is truly unparalleled. The Mont Blanc, highest mountain of the Alps, appears almost near enough to touch. 

Visitors are very close to Italian territory now and look at the “endearing rear” of the famous Matterhorn. Below them at the foot of the mountain, they can see Europe’s largest ski region, open 365 days a year.INFORMATION
Altitude: 3883 m a.s.l.
Arrival: Train from Brig/Visp to Zermatt, on foot or by free e-bus (green line) to the valley station “Matterhorn Glacier Paradise”
Timetable: Operates year-round
Travel duration to summit: 45 mins
Attractions: The Crystal Ride cabins: when floating high above the glacier, the glass floor clears up, highest-altitude viewing platform in Europe, Cinema lounge with new thrilling film scenes focusing on Zermatt, available upon request: VIP cableway car with Moët Champagne between Zermatt and Trockener Steg, world’s highest glacier palace with ice sculptures and an ice slide
Food & beverage: Restaurant with local cuisine
Specials: For adventurers who would like to add a 4000-metre summit to their collection, the Breithorn tour is the very thing, perfect for experienced mountaineers Book your tickets [https://www.matterhornparadise.ch/en/experience/peaks/matterhorn-glacier-paradise] here.

name: Gornergrat
abstract: Surrounded by no fewer than 29 peaks above 4,000 meters, such as the majestic Matterhorn and the Dufourspitze as well as the third-longest glacier of the Alps, Gornergrat rewards visitors with unparalleled views.
description:
Adventure world 
In summer, marvel at the reflection of the Matterhorn on the surface of the Riffelsee and enjoy great hiking trails and cycling routes on this adventure mountain. In winter, the beautiful tobogganing run from Rotenboden to Riffelberg [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/route/schlittelbahn-rotenboden/]is just one of the experiences on offer, with sunny pistes, a children’s ski park and snowball fights on the winter hiking trail [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/route/panorama-trail-1/]all sure to delight both young and old.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 3,089 m a.s.l. Arrival: Train from Brig [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/brig/]/Visp [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/visp/] to Zermatt, from Zermatt [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/zermatt/]by cog railway to the Gornergrat. Timetable: Operates year-round, during the high season in 24-minute intervals Travel duration to summit: 33 minutes to the top, 44 minutes back
Attractions: View on 29 peaks above 4,000 m a.s.l., the glaciers of Monte Rosa, reflection of Matterhorn in Lake Riffel (visible in calm weather), journey with the Gornergrat cog railway to 3,089 m a.s.l.. Food & beverage: Restaurant with a view onto Monte Rosa mountain massif, self-service restaurant, gourmet ticket
Specials: ZOOOM the Matterhorn – a multimedia experience on the Gornergrat.

Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.

Download comprehensive information, including highlights and an adventure map: PDF Info Guide [https://www.mystsnet.com/de/download/broschure-gornergrat-bahn/?wpdmdl=25589&refresh=64394c4bdb3381681476683]

Purchase your Gornergrat mountain railway ticket online [https://www.gornergrat.ch/en/pages/ticket?utm_source=STS&utm_medium=verweis&utm_campaign=STSpartnerlink]

MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=Gornergrat]

name: Gorner Gorge
abstract: The Gorner Gorge is one of the most fascinating scenic attractions in Zermatt. It is an easy 20-minute walk from the south end of the village of Zermatt.
description:
Over 130 years ago Zermatt pioneers discovered a particularly lovely natural attraction: the Gorner Gorge. The gorge was formed by the Gornera River over thousands of years and is known for its unique formations and spectacular waterfalls. The green-tinged serpentinite stone is around 220 million years old.

A well-kept path passes through galleries and over wooden walkways. It is an easy 20-minute walk. You can continue on to Blatten or Moos if you would like a longer walk. More adventurous souls can hire a mountain guide to take a three to four-hour tour of the Gorner Gorge.

From the middle of October it's worth visiting the gorge in the afternoon between 3 p.m. and 4 p.m. because the late afternoon sun turns the waters a striking turquoise.

Getting there: Take the train to Zermatt. The entrance to the gorge is a 20-minute walk away.

name: Climbing the Breithorn
description: The guests are tackling a high mountain peak (Breithorn [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/breithorn-4164m/]) with a guide from Zermatt [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/zermatt/]. Early in the morning, they take the gondola [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/matterhorn-glacier-ride/]to the starting point on the Matterhorn Glacier at 3883 m. Three to four hours should be planned to get up and down in ice and snow, depending on the climbers’ fitness.

name: Sunnegga - Rothorn
abstract: Some people say that the Matterhorn is best viewed from the Rothorn, since it showcases its pyramid shape perfectly. And who are we to argue? The mountains to the east of Zermatt are great viewpoints.
description:
The journey into the mountains begins with the underground funicular railway to Sunnegga (2,288 metres above sea level). This was the first funicular in Switzerland to travel entirely inside a tunnel. At Sunnegga you can watch marmots at play, while the nearby Leisee lake is the perfect spot for a swim.

 The journey then continues by eight-person gondola to Blauherd (2,571 metres above sea level). From here, the themed Marmot Trail leads back to Sunnegga and the five-lake trail into the valley of the Findel Glacier.

Finally, a big cable car takes visitors to the summit of the Unterrothorn (3,103 metres above sea level). The views of most of the 38 four-thousand-metre peaks around Zermatt are quite simply breathtaking.



Altitude: 3,103 metres 
How to get there: Train from Brig/Visp to Zermatt, on foot or by free e-bus (green line) to the valley station Sunnegga-Rothorn: funicular to Sunnegga [https://www.matterhornparadise.ch/en/experience/peaks/sunnegga], gondola to Blauherd [https://www.matterhornparadise.ch/en/experience/peaks/blauherd], cable car to the Rothorn [https://www.matterhornparadise.ch/en/experience/peaks/rothorn]
Views: Across Zermatt to the Obergabelhorn, Zinalrothorn and Weisshorn, with the Bernese Alps in the background, over the Findel Glacier to the Rimpfischhorn and Strahlhorn, over the Gornergrat ridge to Monte Rosa and of course the Matterhorn itself 
Attractions: Starting point to numerous themed hiking trails (e.g. Five Lakes Walk, Path to Freedom, Flower Trail), Moonlight descent in winter, Sunrise rides, Leisee lake with children’s playground
Food and drink: Mountain restaurants at all levels, sun terraces with magnificent mountain views, Rothorn cablecar: Sunrise rides including Älpler breakfast every Tuesday during summer
Accommodation: No accommodation at Sunnegga, Blauherd or Rothorn; Fluhalp has single, double, triple, quadruple and group rooms, Mountain Lodge Ze Seewjinu has double, triple, quadruple and group rooms
Groups: Rothorn has two rooms with seating for 76 in each; Blauherd Blue Lounge; Sunegga has rooms with seating for 192, 140 and 100, conferences for up to 200, meeting rooms 
Winter: Rothorn Paradise winter sports area, linked to the Gornergrat and Matterhorn Paradise 
Special comments: Probably the most photogenic angle for Matterhorn views!

Book your tickets [https://www.matterhornparadise.ch/en/book/tickets/rothorn]

name: Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn – the Alpine adventure railway
abstract: The Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn is an Alpine adventure railway par excellence. The line is 144 kilometres long, running from Zermatt to Disentis and from Andermatt to Göschenen, covering a difference in altitude of 3,300 metres, passing through 33 tunnels and galleries, and crossing 126 bridges and viaducts along the way. The lowest point of the journey is Visp, at 625 metres above sea level, and the highest the Oberalppass at 2,033 metres above sea level.
description:
The “Matterhorn Gotthard Pass” – pure adventure!
The 2, 3 or 5-day “Matterhorn Gotthard Pass” allows you to free travel on the entire Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn network, on BLS trains between Kandersteg and Domodossola, as well as on the SBB line between Salgesch, Brig and Domodossola and all the PostBus routes in Upper Valais. It also entitles you to a 50% discount on numerous funiculars and cable cars, sports and recreational facilities.
More information [https://www.matterhorngotthardbahn.ch/en/pages/matterhorn-gotthard-pass]

Tickets for the Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn are available on sbb.ch [https://www.sbb.ch/].

name: Monte Rosa Tour
abstract: Monte Rosa is an imposing mountain massif south of Zermatt and comprises 10 summits.
description: The Monte Rosa Tour takes you along clearly marked footpaths deep into the mountains and to the top of some of the most beautiful mountains with summits surpassing the 4,000m above sea level mark. The 160 km distance (of which 86 km are on the Valais side and the other 74 km are in the Piemont and Aosta region) is divided into 8 stages and includes 7 mountain passes. Its highest summit, the Dufourspitze (4,634m above sea level), is Switzerland's highest summit and was first climbed in 1855. Europe's highest restaurant is situated on the mountain's 4,554 meter high signalling mound. The Monte Rosa east face is said to be the most imposing rock wall of the Alps. The name originates from an extinct Romance language and means glacier. The Swiss side of the massif can be viewed from the Gornergrat. This walking tour takes 4 days and is suitable for very experienced walkers only.

name: Photo Spot Gornergrat-Matterhorn
abstract: Europe's highest open-air cog railway has been transporting visitors from Zermatt to the summit of Gornergrat at 3,089 metres above sea level since 1898. Every second of the 9,339 metre-long, 33-minute journey is an incomparable delight. The Photo-Spot is open all year round and included in the ticket price. It offers one of the best views of the Matterhorn and 28 other peaks over 4,000 metres, including the Monte Rosa massif and the highest mountain in Switzerland, the Dufourspitze which stands at 4,634 metres above sea level.

name: Glacier Palace in the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
abstract: High, higher - the Glacier Palace in the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. Even the mountain train ride tops all records.
description:
At 3820 m, you step out into a world of snow, ice and mountain peaks. To the west you see the Matterhorn [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/matterhorn-4478-m-asl-landmark-of-switzerland/], the most famous mountain in Switzerland, and in the East is the Breithorn with the majestic Monte Rosa behind it. On the broad glacier between the Klein Matterhorn and the Breithorn is the highest Glacier Palace in the world, offering fantastic views of the fascinating world of snow and ice.

A lift travels 15 m into a glacier where glittering ice crystals and ice sculptures generate a world of their own. They are periodically replaced by new creations from different artists. An ice tunnel continues through the glacier to an ice chute or into a crevasse. Soft and fluffy seats are provided on ice benches to make the icy adventure cosy and comfortable. 

Directions:
By car from Sierre [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/sierre/]via Visp [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/visp/]to Täsch [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/taesch/], from Täsch by train to Zermatt [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/zermatt/]and by mountain transportation [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/matterhorn-glacier-ride/]to the Matterhorn glacier paradise, by public transportation from Sierre via Visp to Zermatt, mountain transportation.
